result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie Ann Reffruschinni was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to count 4; with credit for 0 days time served

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample. Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
- Restitution set at $0.00.

- No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
- No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.

- Complete a psychiatric or psychological evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment or services.
- Write a letter of apology to West Allis Police Department.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: STAYED; to be used at the Department's discretion

supervisions.notes: Court ordered a fine of $200.00 to be paid during the term of supervision.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephanie Ann Reffruschinni

records.addlTxt:
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence AND CONSECUTIVE to Count 4, with credit for 0 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court ordered a fine of $200.00 to be paid during the term of supervision. 

AS TO COUNT 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence AND CONSECUTIVE to Count 2, with credit for 0 days time served.

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 4: 
The Court STAYED these sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- 30 DAYS condition time STAYED and to be used at the department's discretion. 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens. 
- Provide DNA sample.
- Maintain employment.
- No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
- No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause. 
- Complete 30 HOURS of community service. 
- Complete a psychiatric or psychological evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment or services. 
- Write a letter of apology to West Allis Police Department. 
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department. 


Court set restitution at $0.00.  Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

20 day appeal rights given.

Defendant Stephanie Ann Reffruschinni in court.  Attorney Marcus J Sengstock in court for Stephanie Ann Reffruschinni.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for plea/sentencing.  State filed Amended Information.  Defense acknowledges receipt of Amended Information, waives formal reading, and pleads not guilty on behalf of Ms. Reffruschinni. 

...
Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Defendant sworn. 

AS TO COUNTS 2-4:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to pleas, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Sentencing proceeded.
Received and Filed: Defendant's Character Letters

Defendant Stephanie Ann Reffruschinni in court with attorney Marcus J Sengstock.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Stephanie Ann Reffruschinni in court with attorney Marcus J Sengstock, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person and Julie Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 051273,
Payable Number: 1010104,
Receipt Number: 22RP022018,
Amount: $20.00

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.  DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 5-21-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Stephanie Ann Reffruschinni in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson. Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT MAY QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER SERVICES. The Defendant was advised to contact the Public Defender's Office and provide additional information.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/19/2022@1:30p
